summary: Thomas W. Sacco was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978. These documents provide details such as his salary and employment dates within the SCA. The documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, but his presence on payroll indicates he was a staff member involved in the committee's operations during its investigation.
significance: Thomas W. Sacco's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although his specific role is not detailed in these documents.
